messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
There's somebody, there's a guy, and I'm home alone, and he's banging on my door. Please, I need somebody here, quick.
Okay, I need your address.
West 79th Street.
Is that a house or an apartment?
A house.
What's your phone number?
[Phone number]
Tell me exactly what happened.
There's a guy, and I'm home alone. He's talking on my door, please. I need somebody here, quick.
Did he open the door?
He opened the door. He opened the...
You opened your front door?
He opened the door.
What's your name?
Cynthia.
Are you expecting anyone?
No, no, no. I need someone quick.
Okay, stay on the line with me. Don't hang up. Are you in a room or anywhere by yourself?
No.
Can you get into a room somewhere that you can lock yourself in?
No, I can't.
Why can't you?
He's in the house. He's looking at me, please.
What do you mean he's looking at you?
He's not looking at me. I need someone here.
How old are you?
You're 12 and you're home alone?
I need a police officer here quick.
Okay, listen. I'm asking you these questions so I can send help out to you. Can you get into your room or lock yourself in your room or something?
Okay, I'm in the room.
Okay, did you lock yourself in the room?
Yes.
And you're not expecting anyone?
No.
You said he opened your front door?
Yes.
Okay, give me one second. And you told me your name again?
Cynthia.
Was this guy going through the front door or the back door?
The front door.
Did you see him? Did you see if he was white, black, or what clothes he was wearing?
He's white, he's wearing a green shirt and white pants.
Give me one second. Was he driving a car?
Yes, a regular four-door car.
Was it an SUV or anything?
It was a small car.
Okay, hold on a second. Can you see if you can find out more details on the car?
No, I can't.
Alright, stay in the room, keep the door locked, and stay on the line with me. Are your parents around?
My dad is away.
What kind of car does your dad drive?
A Dodge.
What color?
Gray.
Alright, stay on the phone with me. Are you still in the room?
Yes.
Are you hiding?
Yes.
Alright, stay as quiet as you can. The police should be getting there soon.
Okay.
Can you see the intruder?
He's trying to open my room door.
Okay, stay calm. Do you still hear him inside the house?
Yes, I hear him opening doors.
Okay, just stay quiet and stay on the phone with me, alright?
I think he's trying to find something.
Alright, stay with me. Help is on the way. Are you okay?
I think he's trying the back door.
Do you hear him still inside the house?
Yes, he's trying to get out.
Alright, stay in your room until I tell you it's safe to come out.
The police should be arriving soon. Stay on the phone with me.
Okay.
Is he still inside?
Yes.
Okay, help is almost there. Stay calm.
I think I hear the police.
Alright, keep quiet and stay hidden until it's safe. The police will find you.
Okay.
Is the intruder still inside the house?
I think he heard the police and ran out.
Okay, stay where you are. The police will come to you.
The police are here. I hear them.
Alright, stay on the phone with me until they reach you, okay?
Okay.
Just stay on the line until you're safe.
I think they're telling him to put his hands up.
Good, stay quiet.
I can't see anything. I'm in the closet.
Stay in the closet until they tell you it's safe.
Okay.
You're doing great. Stay calm.
The police are here. They have dogs and everything.
Okay, do you still hear the intruder?
No, I don't think so.
Stay on the line until an officer reaches you, okay?
They're telling him to put his hands up.
Just stay where you are.
Okay.
I can't see anything. I'm still in the closet.
Stay there until they make contact with you.
Okay.
The police are inside the house now.
Good. Stay there until they come to you.
They're calling out for me.
Okay, you can call out to them now.
Thank you.
You're welcome. Stay safe.
